trans-unit.source: Provides a listener that directs <xref href="System.Diagnostics.Trace"></xref> messages to ASP.NET Web page outputs.

The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute> attribute applied to this class has the following <xref:System.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.Resources%2A> property value: <xref:System.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionResource.Synchronization>.

The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute> does not affect desktop applications (which are typically started by double-clicking an icon, typing a command, or entering a URL in a browser).

For more information, see the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute> class or [SQL Server Programming and Host Protection Attributes](~/docs/framework/performance/sql-server-programming-and-host-protection-attributes.md).
The <xref:System.Web.WebPageTraceListener> class forwards trace messages that are written to the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Trace> log to ASP.NET Web page output channels.

You can enable trace forwarding by adding a <xref:System.Web.WebPageTraceListener> object to your Web.config file as a listener in the [trace Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/05f08d15-1e2c-4c56-84d1-b1d7ba039af6) subsection of the [\<system.diagnostics\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/trace-debug/system-diagnostics-element.md) section.
You can also add a <xref:System.Web.WebPageTraceListener> to the listeners collection programmatically.
Commonly, this is done by adding a <xref:System.Web.WebPageTraceListener> to the collection during application startup, using the `Application_Start` method in the Global.asax file.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.WebPageTraceListener"></xref> class.
Writes an event message to a Web page or to the ASP.NET trace viewer using the specified system and event data.
The <xref:System.Web.WebPageTraceListener.TraceEvent%2A> method writes the event message to the <xref:System.Web.TraceContext> object using `source` as the category and `message` as the message.
A <xref href="System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache"></xref> that contains the current process and thread IDs and stack trace information.
A category name used to organize the output.
One of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType"></xref> values.
A numeric identifier for the event.
A message to write.
Writes a localized event message to a Web page or to the ASP.NET trace viewer using the specified system and event data.

The <xref:System.Web.WebPageTraceListener.TraceEvent%2A> method calls the <xref:System.String.Format%28System.IFormatProvider%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Object%5B%5D%29> method, passing `format` and `args` and using the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.InvariantCulture%2A> property to format the string as the message to write to the trace viewer or Web page.
A <xref href="System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache"></xref> that contains the current process and thread IDs and stack trace information.
A category name used to organize the output.
One of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType"></xref> values.
A numeric identifier for the event.
A format string that contains zero or more format items, which correspond to objects in args.
An array of zero or more objects to format.
Writes a message to a Web page or to the ASP.NET trace viewer.
The <xref:System.Web.WebPageTraceListener.Write%2A> method does not write to the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Trace> object output, even if it is enabled in the configuration file.
The message to write.
Writes a category name and a message to a Web page or to the ASP.NET trace viewer.
The <xref:System.Web.WebPageTraceListener.Write%2A> method does not write to the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Trace> object output, even if it is enabled in the configuration file.
The message to write.
A category name used to organize the output.
Writes a message to a Web page or to the ASP.NET trace viewer.
The <xref:System.Web.WebPageTraceListener.WriteLine%2A> method does not write to the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Trace> object output, even if it is enabled in the configuration file.
The message to write.
Writes a category name and a message to a Web page or to the ASP.NET trace viewer.
The <xref:System.Web.WebPageTraceListener.WriteLine%2A> method does not write to the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Trace> object output, even if it is enabled in the configuration file.
The message to write.
A category name used to organize the output.
